meanings.definition: A ghostly double or counterpart of a living person.
meanings.sent1: She believed she saw her doppelganger standing in the mirror.
meanings.sent2: The actor found his doppelganger in the audience, looking almost identical to him.
meanings.sent3: Seeing her doppelganger in the mirror gave her a spooky feeling.
meanings.sent4: The shadowy figure in the corner seemed like a doppelganger of her own fears.
meanings.sent5: The doppelganger in the haunted house mimicked her every move, sending shivers down her spine.

meanings.definition: A person who closely resembles another in appearance.
meanings.sent1: They were mistaken for doppelgangers because of their striking resemblance.
meanings.sent2: The twins looked so alike that they could pass as doppelgangers.
meanings.sent3: It was amusing to see the doppelganger of the celebrity working at the local store.
meanings.sent4: Her reflection in the water seemed like a doppelganger of her sister.
meanings.sent5: The doppelganger at the party caused confusion as everyone mistook him for the host.
